content.text: The Web is the largest human-made information space. Searching it requires overcoming massive challenges of scale, diversity, and deception.
content.hook: The web is not a library; it's a jungle.

content.text: 1. Scale: Billions of pages. 2. Dynamism: Content changes daily. 3. Diversity: Languages, formats, and quality. 4. Spam: Adversarial IR (keyword stuffing, link farms).
The web structure is a 'Directed Graph'. It follows a Power Law distribution (a few sites have millions of links; most have almost none).
content.hook: The Bow-tie Structure of the Web: Strong Connected Component (SCC), IN, OUT, and Tendrils.

content.description: The logic of the large-scale web graph structure.
Visit a random personal blog and Wikipedia. Compare: 1. Outgoing links, 2. Page depth, 3. Frequency of updates. Which one is harder for Google to crawl?
